item.title: Judge extends ban on Trump firing federal workers during government shutdown
item.description: A federal judge extended a temporary order blocking the Trump administration's mass-layoff plans during the government shutdown, multiple news outlets...

item.title: States sue Trump administration to keep SNAP benefits during government shutdown
item.description: The SNAP program provides food stamps to about 42 million Americans. The program is on the verge of running out of funds because of the government shu...

item.title: U.S. military officials required to sign NDAs tied to Latin America mission: Reuters
item.description: Lawmakers in Congress say they are being kept in the dark about key aspects of a military buildup that Venezuela fears may lead to an invasion.

item.title: Mining execs embrace 'phenomenal' rare earths interest from the Middle East
item.description: Mining executives have welcomed bumper investor interest in critical minerals from the Middle East.

item.title: Trump Treasury Sec. Bessent says he's felt 'pain' from China because he's a 'soybean farmer'
item.description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent's estimated hundreds and millions of dollars in wealth includes soybean and corn farmland in North Dakota.
